text: Phillips County is a county found in the U.S. state of Montana. As of the 2020 United States Census, there were 4,217 people. Its county seat is Malta. Before February 5, 1915, Phillips County was part of Blaine County, Montana, and before 1912 both were part of Chouteau County, Montana. It was named for rancher and state senator Benjamin D. Phillips. Its northern boundary is the Canadaâ€“United States border with Saskatchewan. The Missouri River defines its southern boundary. == References == Category:1910s establishments in Montana Category:1915 establishments in the United States Category:Montana counties
title: Phillips County, Montana
